title: How to Make a Beet Salad

steps.headline: Clean 4 bunches of small, fresh beets or 2 very large fresh beets.
steps.description: Remove the stems and brush the outer skin clean with a potato brush.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit (232 degrees Celsius).

text: Clean 4 bunches of small, fresh beets or 2 very large fresh beets. Remove the stems and brush the outer skin clean with a potato brush. Preheat the oven to 450 degrees Fahrenheit (232 degrees Celsius). If you use a convection oven, set it to 425 degrees Fahrenheit (218 degrees Celsius). Brush the beets with olive oil and sprinkle them lightly with sea salt. Leaving the skin on will make them easier to handle and stop them from bleeding too much during the cooking process. Place the beets in a baking dish and place them in the oven. Bake them for 40 minutes. Remove the beets from the oven and place them in the refrigerator for 15 minutes.  Peel the beets using gentle pressure with your fingers, once they have cooled.  Dice the beets and place them in a large bowl.  Mix the dressing in a blender or food processor. If you do not have either of these machines, use a whisk. Place 1 tbsp. (14.8 ml) of honey, 2 tbsp. (29.6 ml) Dijon mustard, 1 tbsp. (14.8 ml) lemon juice, 2 tbsp. (29.6 ml) of white wine vinegar and 1 tsp. (4.7 g) dried thyme in the food processor. Add 1/2 cup (118.2 ml) of olive oil and a dash of salt and pepper. Blend well. Place 1 lb. (453.6 g) butter lettuce, spinach or spring mix in a bowl. Toss the lettuce with the dressing.  Divide the salad amongst 4 serving plates.  Cover the lettuce with the beets and sprinkle with 1 ounce (28.3 g) of feta cheese on each plate.  Serve immediately.
